channel.title: [Delta] characterfile.write issues
channel.description:
I'm trying to make it so in my character files there is a line reading "character-dicer = 0"
So, I put in an int [code=java]public int dicer = 0;[/code]
I also placed this in case 2: [code=java] else if (token.equals("character-dicer")) { dicer = Integer.parseInt(token2); }[/code]
and lastely, i placed the characterfile.write [code=java] characterfile.write("character-dicer = ", 0, 25); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(dicer), 0, Integer.toString(dicer).length()); characterfile.newLine();[/code]
Now, where the "25" is in the character write is what I'm coming up clueless on. Everything compiles fine, when I log in everything is fine, but when I go to log out I get [code] String index out of range: 25[/code]
I've changed that number to 19 and 20, getting the same outcomes. I'm unsure what I need to make that number, or if that is truly even the problem.

item.title: [Delta] characterfile.write issues
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

I got it guys’. StringIndexOutOfBoundsException indicates that "character-dicer - " is not at least 25 characters long, so I had to change the 25 to an 18. Thanks for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] characterfile.write issues
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Let me redo my previous post.

What you happen to be doing is accessing a part of the string that doesn’t exist. Say you have 3 characters in your string, and you use 6. You will get that error because you’re trying to use six characters instead of 3.

Change it to 18.

Edit:
If you have anymore problems, private message me.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] characterfile.write issues
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

maybe change “public int dicer = 0;” to “public int dicer;”

thats the only difference that i see. i had to add a starter. not sure if it would make a difference

item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Try changing it to 24.

Same error, spammed

String index out of range: 24
upon logout

item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

I’m trying to make it so in my character files there is a line reading “character-dicer = 0”

So, I put in an int

I also placed this in case 2:

else if (token.equals("character-dicer")) { dicer = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

and lastely, i placed the characterfile.write

characterfile.write("character-dicer = ", 0, 25); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(dicer), 0, Integer.toString(dicer).length()); characterfile.newLine();

Now, where the “25” is in the character write is what I’m coming up clueless on. Everything compiles fine, when I log in everything is fine, but when I go to log out I get

I’ve changed that number to 19 and 20, getting the same outcomes. I’m unsure what I need to make that number, or if that is truly even the problem.
